content:
Hello,
I have a general question regrading github and zulip integration.
We have created a stream name which is ùù∫ Clojure, ùù∫ is an Unicode value.
We try to add the following line to one of our github repositories.
https://yourZulipDomain.zulipchat.com/api/v1/external/github?api_key=abcdefgh&stream=ùù∫%20Clojure

However, github doesn't want to accept ùù∫ character, so we try to use F0.9D.9D.BA-Clojure instead.
(we get that name by clicking on the stream name on the left and copy it from top where you usually type your URL.
The whole thing is https://yourZulipDomain.zulipchat.com/#streams/16/.F0.9D.9D.BA.20Clojure)

Github has accepted .F0.9D.9D.BA.20Clojure, but any issue or pull requests from github never goes to ùù∫ Clojure stream.
We also receive error message that says that there is no .F0.9D.9D.BA.20Clojure stream.
The following is the message.
Your bot tried to send a message to stream #.F0.9D.9D.BA-Clojure, but that stream does not exist. Click here to create it.

My question is that how we can resolve this issue.
Do we need to recreate a new stream name without using Unicode?
Or do we need to do something differently to make github to accept our stream name ùù∫ Clojure?

Thank you so much for taking your time to read my message.

John
Query parameters of a URL need to be URL-encoded. Use &stream=%F0%9D%9D%BA%20Clojure.

Anders Kaseorg said:

Query parameters of a URL need to be URL-encoded. Use &stream=%F0%9D%9D%BA%20Clojure.

Anders,
Thank you so much for taking the time to reply to my message.
I will give it a try. :)

jcheng said:

Anders Kaseorg said:

Query parameters of a URL need to be URL-encoded. Use &stream=%F0%9D%9D%BA%20Clojure.

Anders,
Thank you so much for taking the time to reply to my message.
I will give it a try. :)

Anders,
Thanks a lot. That did the trick! =)
